title: Government announces appointments to Hong Kong Council on Smoking and Health
content_text:
p>
	The Government announced today (October 30) the appointment of Dr Lee George 
	Lam and Dr Christina Maw Kit-chee as new members of the Hong Kong Council on 
	Smoking and Health. Three serving members, Dr Susie Lum Shun-sui, Dr David Sun Yee-wha and Mr 
	Jackson Wong Fan-foung, are re-appointed.  All the appointments are effective from October 1 for a term of two years.
	 The Hong Kong Council on Smoking and Health is an independent statutory body

The Hong Kong Council on Smoking and Health is an independent statutory body established in 1987 to advise the Government on matters related to smoking and health. It is also tasked with advancing public education concerning the effects of smoking on the community and individuals as well as with engaging in smoking-related research. The full membership of the Council with effect from October 1, 2015 is as follows: Mr Antonio Kwong Cho-shing (Chairman)
Miss Yolanda Ng Yuen-ting (Vice-Chairman)

Miss Yolanda Ng Yuen-ting (Vice-Chairman)
